meanings.sent1: Yesterday, we jetted to Paris for vacation.
meanings.sent2: The family jetted across the ocean to visit relatives.
meanings.sent3: The friends jetted off to an exotic island for a weekend getaway.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams jetted her to far-off lands while she slept.
meanings.sent5: The spaceship jetted through the galaxy at incredible speeds.

meanings.definition: To shoot out in a stream
meanings.sent1: The water jetted out of the broken pipe.
meanings.sent2: The fountain jetted water high into the air.
meanings.sent3: The hose jetted water unexpectedly, soaking everyone nearby.
meanings.sent4: The volcano jetted lava and ash into the sky.
meanings.sent5: The fire hydrant jetted water with great force when opened.

meanings.sent1: The rabbit jetted across the field to escape the fox.
meanings.sent2: The car jetted down the highway at top speed.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel jetted up the tree to avoid the barking dog.
meanings.sent4: The athlete jetted past the competition to win the race.
meanings.sent5: The wind jetted through the open window, scattering papers around the room.
